channel.title: Thoughts on Jared Braggins
channel.description: Recent content in Thoughts on Jared Braggins

item.title: Imposter Syndrome and the Benefit of Self-Reflection
item.description: The focus of this month’s #SWDChallenge was on artisanal data. I found this challenge to be incredibly enjoyable. Why? Because I got to design a visualisation using data that I knew inside and out (since it was about my work history after all!). But hey, that was kinda the point, right? I want to take a step back here though. I want to address why I used data about my work history.

item.title: Finding the Motivation
item.description: It has been a tough few months in the lead up to Christmas. I’ve found my motivation to do, well, anything in data visualisation has severely waned. As a result, I took steps to try and reinvigorate my interest in what I was doing. For example, I started learning Tableau in late July, and shortly after began to post to things to my Tableau Public profile. I even started taking part in the #SWDchallenge.

item.title: Nearly A Year Later ...
item.description: Hey there! It’s been awhile. Habits are interesting things. Good habits take awhile to form, but can be incredibly beneficial. I like forming good habits, but over the previous 11 months I’ve noticed how easy it is to break a habit - namely, blogging. I started blogging back in November 2017 to get back into writing in a way that I actually enjoy, and to force myself to write about what I’m learning.
